lines.text: Do you want one of the board members to see you? They'll say you're a sniffling hysterical pre-periodic twit!
I have a right to my own feelings Sadie and I am not a twit. I may be pre-periodic and I may be hysterical. So what?
So there are drugs for those things and we make most of them!
Is this how we dress for the office? You look like a blood clot!
Hey, I like your kimono! D'ya get that in 'Nam?
Ah no, Fire Island.
I had other plans this evening.
I know what your plans were, to hold up in your room and make love to the pastry cart. Now put down the éclair and get down there.
You're in America now. Speak American.
There's two of everyone in there.
My God it's me with a bad haircut.
Bad? I paid twelve bucks for this.
I am gonna kick your ass!
I don't see how is it that you, my own sister, can stuff your face and nothing happens and I subsist on 60 calories a day or else blow up like a Macy's Day float!
That's what the French call a bedet.
Well, those French must be taller than me.

[about to give Binky Shelton a shot]
Don't worry, it will only take one little prick.
That's what got me into this trouble in the first place!
I hate my job... I hate shopping... I hate New York in June. How about you?
I hate men who smell like beer and bean dip... and makin' love in the back of recreational vehicles!
Isn't it exciting?
Oh yeah, the noise, the smog, the crowds, the muggers, sex fiends, white slavers, politicians, it's a pistol. I got about as much use for it as a toad has for spit curls!
What fantasy is this? Are we hearing voices now like Joan of Arc?
Oh my God, how did I get so fat? I look like a walleyed salmon! What did he use a wide angle lens?
How in God's name could you drive me out here to Hickville, West Virginia when I'm fourty months pregnant?
Roone, would you care to join us for dinner?
Well sure, I could use a tuny fish sandwich

[after giving a speech]
And I've said my piece. Amen!

[assuming she is speaking to Rose Shelton]
Hi, Rose, how's Duke doing?
Duke! My dog? Boy, when you go snoopin' into people's lives you don't miss a trick do you?

The most fiscally prudent action at this point is to take an aggressive posture and divest ourselves of Hollow-o-Made. It's a little backwards furniture factory. They actually still make porch rockers. Now, the opportunities for expansion are virtually nil and the buyer has offered us a most attractive price. So, you can see gentlemen, that were we to liquidate Hollow-o-Made; the return on our investment would; in fact, be... quadrupled.

Well, the liquidation. I mean aren't there other considerations? May I make a point? I'm sitting, listening here and what I'm feeling... ah... deeply inside. I... I mean what, what it is, I. Things are just not computing exactly right. I mean I'm sorry.
Gentlemen, help yourself to danish.
[walks over to Rose]
How many times have I told you not to talk about things which you don't understand.

[Rushing to the elevator]
Hold the door. Hold the door! Hold the door!
[turns around and walks away after door closes in her face]
Moron!
That's some classical music you got there, right?
Uh, yes.
I could tell. No lyrics.
